author: Aayush Puthran | India.com Sports Desk
title: David Miller OUT! India vs South Africa 3rd ODI – Watch Video Highlights of Fall of Wicket
text:
David Miller OUT! India vs South Africa 3rd ODI – Watch Video Highlights of Fall of Wicket By India.com Sports Desk on October 18, 2015 at 2:29 PM Comments India get their first breakthrough as David Miller is out to Harbhajan Singh for a well-made 33. You can watch the video highlights of the fall of wicket here . South Africa have gotten off to a good start after electing to bat first in the third One-Day International (ODI) match at the Saurashtra Cricket Association (SCA) Stadium in Rajkot on Sunday. The opening duo of Quinton de Kock and David Miller put on a half-century stand for the first wicket. They went about scoring at run a ball, without much trouble on a pitch that offered little help to the bowlers. (Also Watch: India vs South Africa 3 rd ODI Free Live Streaming h ere ) Earlier in the day, South Africa skipper AB de Villiers won the toss and elected to bat first. Even as they came in with an unchanged Playing XI, David Miller was sent in to open the innings with Quinton de Kock. India dropped pacer Umesh Yadav and added a third spinner to their side. Amit Mishra came into the side as the only change to the side that won at Indore. (Also Watch: India vs South Africa 3 rd ODI Free Livce Streaming h ere ) The five-match Paytm Friendship series is currently levelled at 1-1 after MS Dhoni’s unbeaten 92 guided India to a 22-run win at the Holkar Stadium on Wednesday. Mohit Sharma and Bhuvneshwar Kumar have taken the two new balls for India in the third ODI. (Also Catch: India vs South Africa 3 rd ODI Live Score Updates here ) India ODI Squad: MS Dhoni (C), Virat Kohli, Shikhar Dhawan, Rohit Sharma, Suresh Raina, Ajinkya Rahane, Ambati Rayudu, Stuart Binny, Gurkeerat Singh Mann, Axar Patel, R Ashwin, Amit Mishra, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Mohit Sharma, Umesh Yadav. South Africa ODI Squad: AB De Villiers (C), Hashim Amla, Quinton de Kock, Faf Du Plessis, JP Duminy, David Miller, Farhaan Behardien, Chris Morris, Khaya Zondo, Aaron Phangiso, Imran Tahir, Dale Steyn, Morne Morkel, Kyle Abbott, Kagiso Rabada.
